This position will directly influence student success by providing actionable datasets to faculty, staff, administrators, and students through effective data visualizations and tools. What motivates us to come to work every day is the feeling that we are helping our diverse community learn, grow, and be more inclusive. Our department is uniquely positioned at the college to make a difference by providing the data and stories to influence decisions that will impact student experience and outcomes.*    The Data Warehouse Assistant Director is responsible for leading a team of engineers to design, implement, maintain, and support the data warehousing system. This position will require a motivated and experienced data analyst/engineer who can ask critical questions, develop, and optimize processes to effectively handle the increasing demand for data and analysis. The ideal candidate must be able to identify best practices and innovate solutions to data engineering challenges to ensure the DSA team is delivering the most effective data insights possible. This position will collaborate with administrators, staff, faculty, and students to understand the opportunities for data and data-informed insights at the College. The position requires a focus on delivering trusted, validated, and accurate data.*    Under the general supervision of the Director of Data Science & Analytics, the incumbent defines and executes an enterprise data strategy and architecture that supports innovative and efficient analytics for the entire college. The position directs future data initiatives to ensure data governance, quality, and accessibility as well as oversee institutional performance and official reporting.*    The incumbent will be expected to appropriately ask critical questions and optimize current data reporting, warehousing, and analytics processes. The incumbent must be able to gather requirements to develop, deploy, and maintain analytics optimized data warehouse. This position is responsible for maintaining and optimizing data integrations. Additionally, the incumbent is responsible for developing processes to monitor data quality and working with business users and subject matter experts to fix data quality issues.*   Essential Serve as the office’s representative on various committees and at various meetings. *   Support team efforts to improve collegewide data literacy. *   Other duties as assigned.*  *  *    Essential Title: Risk Analyst Associate - Merchant Underwriting Compliance
Description: * *  Company Description*   Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.*   When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.*   Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.*  * *  Job Description*   The Associate Risk Analyst will be an integral part of our Bundled Acquiring Operations Group and will be responsible for supporting the business needs and underwriting compliance of our growing merchant base. The Risk team is primarily responsible for monitoring and investigating the processing of Merchant Acquiring and eCheck merchants for fraud and/or suspicious behavior. The mandate of this team is to identify fraudulent merchants and transactions, as well as processing that may indicate credit impairment, and use funding holds to protect Visa from financial losses. The team is also responsible for monitoring and mitigating card testing across the entire Cybersource and Authorize.Net portfolios, as well as investigating and approving requests for standalone credits. Finally, the team works with merchants in the Chargeback Programs.*   Specific Responsibilities include:*  Review incoming documents from our merchants for accuracy and compliance. This will include reviewing and analyzing fraud trends as they arise and communicating them to management.*   Review merchant processing to identify unusual processing that would indicate potential fraud or expose the company to undue risk.*   Persistent merchant monitoring to review accounts that have exceeded their monthly processing limits, have suspicious activity, abnormal transaction amounts, and/or accounts flagged by our acquiring partners needing review.*   Monitor merchant processing for chargebacks and respond quickly to any issues that could indicate a large risk exposure.*   Review and analyze eCheck.Net transaction processing to ensure compliance with NACHA guidelines.*   Monitor all Authorize.Net and Cybersource gateway accounts for card testing and implement measures necessary to halt activity.*   Interact with merchants professionally on sensitive issues involving risk and funding reserves.*   Assist Sales Representatives and Account Management with customer inquiries requiring explanation of specific credit and risk policies and decisions related to those policies.*   Review and research reports from third-party vendors designed to alert us to potential money or transaction laundering.*   Ability to quickly adapt to changing fraud trends and learn new processes designed to protect the company from risk-related losses.*   Position Details - *  Competitive hourly wage along with possible annual bonus and an annual review of comp*   Paid training*   Shifts from 8AM to 5PM, Mon through Fri*   Medical, Dental and Vision insurance, with no waiting period*   401(k) with a company match (You put in 1.00 USD, we put in 2.00 USD)- Always fully vested*   Generous paid time off (21 days for years 1-5, and increases after that)*   11 paid holidays per year*   Education Assistance, Adoption Assistance, and Commuter Assistance available*   Rewarding environment with opportunity for advancement*   * *  Qualifications*  *    Basic Qualifications*   Minimum of 6 months of work experience or a Bachelor's Degree*    Preferred Qualifications*   Prior experience in underwriting, risk, merchant acquiring and ecommerce environments is*    preferred.*   Credit analysis and underwriting experience a plus.*    Demonstrates commitment to quality, attention to detail and customer service.*    Excellent verbal and written communications, interpersonal skills, customer orientation, team*    interaction, problem solving and multi-tasking skills required.*   Must have punctual, regular and consistent attendance.*    High School Diploma required, Associate or Bachelor's degree a plus.*    Advanced knowledge of Windows/PC including Excel and Word.*    Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities.*    Ability to work with team members by assisting in day-to-day department discussions.*    Ability to resolve complex problems with minimal guidance.*   *   Additional Information*   **Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.*   Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.*   Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.*   Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.*   Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.*   Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.* *

Title: Analyst, MRM
Description: * * *  Data Analyst*   *  Description*   *   MRM is looking for a Data Analyst to drive measurement, analysis, and insights supporting marketing campaigns and customer experiences for some of the world’s most recognizable global brands. As a key contributor for the Performance Analytics team, you will perform in-depth analysis on marketing performance to guide investments and optimization. The ideal candidate will be fluent in the use of data to drive decision making while being a strong communicator and storyteller. You will report to the Director, Performance Analytics.*   *   Responsibilities*   *  Provide data-driven insights and optimization recommendations to business stakeholders as it relates to marketing campaigns *   Develop reporting and dashboards that effectively facilitate collective understanding of underlying performance drivers and deliver actionable insights to inform business decisions *   Define and execute progressive learning roadmaps used build a strong body of insights and key learnings driving client business *   Lead clients in the defining of KPIs, measurement methodology and technical requirements *   Synthesize learnings and present to business stakeholders*   *   Requirements*   *  2-4 years of relevant work experience in marketing analytics or similar role, working with large, differentiated data sets. *   Experience B2B marketing methodologies and metrics strongly recommended *   Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills including analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations. *   Use analytical approaches to real business situations - the data is messy, inputs are different, and there are lots of nuances *   Experience in database querying *   Familiarity with the various types of data including behavioral (web) analytics, CRM, media, search and marketing automation data. *   Experience with data visualization tools preferably Tableau or Microsoft Power BI. *   Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and manage multiple stakeholders. *   Working knowledge across a range of marketing disciplines including digital advertising, digital experience, content and social *   Exceptional writing and presentation skills; experience presenting complex concepts in simple ways within high-profile, high-pressure situations to executive audiences *   Excellent multi-tasking, time management and project management skills. *   Strong background in measurement methodologies including tagging and tracking *   Strength in developing data strategy deliverables involving the creation of scalable digital taxonomies*   *   About MRM  MRM is a leading customer relationship agency that leverages the power of creativity, the beauty of data, and the magic of technology to nurture, encourage and sustain strong relationships between brands and their customers – in turn, creating meaningful experiences for people, while driving business results.*   *   We employ the most innovative talent in the industry to digitally drive the transformation of our clients’ businesses and provide creative solutions to help brands grow meaningful relationships with people.*   *   Accolades for MRM//McCann include being named Ad Age's 2018 B-to-B Agency of the Year, a leader in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Global Marketing Agencies, Top Large Agency by the Digital Analytics Association, as well as many others.*   *   Working at MRM *   We believe that fostering an inclusive global community is a crucial component in ensuring that we are inventing meaningful and effective work on behalf of our clients — work that reflects the world in which we live. That is why our beliefs in Diversity and Inclusion are part of every relationship we foster, and always present in guiding our creative vision. We value a workplace culture in which all people are treated with dignity, respect and fairness. We require an environment where there is zero tolerance for any harassment or discrimination. We will empower individuals to take action and be creative when solving problems. And we expect self-awareness and accountability from team members at all levels of the organization. This is our promise: We will remain steadfast in providing a safe, fulfilling and encouraging work environment for every employee and business partner, with the clear understanding that all people and perspectives are welcome.
